titles.title: Civic Justice Corps Act of 2011
To provide grants for Civic Justice Corps programs for court-involved, previously incarcerated, and otherwise disadvantaged youth and young adults.
Civic Justice Corps Act of 2011

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

committee.name: House Education and the Workforce
committee.subcommittee: Early Childhood, Elementary, and Secondary Education

bill.summary: Civic Justice Corps Act of 2011 - Directs the Attorney General to award three-year Civic Justice Corps grants to national nonprofit organizations (national intermediaries) that have experience in developing and administering programs to deliver education and work experience to court-involved, formerly incarcerated, and otherwise disadvantaged youth and young adults between the ages of 16 and 25. Requires such organizations to develop, implement, and collect data from Civic Justice Corps programs administered by at least nine local subgrantees in diverse geographic locations. Requires national intermediaries and subgrantees to submit annual reports on performance measures of participant progress.
